title: I don't understand the types of genres in music. Can someone explain what each kind of them mean citing examples? - Quora

response.answer_text: I will try my best friend... There are many genres in music... I will concentrate on the common genres though.. Romantic This genre is all about love.. the songs have lyrics which are touching to heart and makes you feel that love is everything.. In Hindi the best example is pehla nasha song. Similarly in English Love me like you do by Ellie. Again this genre is further subdivided into fast romantic and slow romantic which is purely based on the pace of song.Party This genre is based described as songs which you usually want to listen on picnic trips or in a pub or bar. They are the songs which is not completely serious dance but makes you tap your feet or hands. One Hindi example is Lungi dance and in English you can listen to rappers like Eminem or Metallica. They make you tap your feet but not exactly dance like professional dancers.Dance This genre is often confused with party. Well according to me these are either the songs which you usually choose for your dance competitions or songs to which you listen on marriages. They are more louder than party songs but have some great music which can be used to dance seriously. MJ's songs can be classified as dance songs. But many songs are there which can be both party and dance.Devotional It's easy to understand as the songs main motive is to pray God or call him to listen to us. In Hindi there are large number of devotional songs. Tumhi ho maata pita tumhi ho is one example.I find these are some important and popular genre of Hindi or English songs. Hope this answer helps you a little...

Music is very vast and there are a lot of genres, Talking on international standards, here are some : 1. Pop- All the famous mainstream artists that you may have heard of might be pop, from Justin Bieber to One Direction, Maroon 5 to Britney Spears and Ariana Grande. These are the typical songs played at clubs. 2. R&B- Rhythm and Blues includes modern artists like Bruno Mars (He can be counted as Pop too), Usher and Chris Brown. It's a very old genre so you can dig into it more and you will find lots of artists. It's hard to differentiate modern r&b and pop because they sound very similar. 3. Rap/Hip Hop- Eminem, Macklemore, 50 Cent, Nas, Dr Dre, Ice cube are all hip hop artists involves fast tones and trippy beats and they are usually lyrically heavy. Every Thug Life meme video has hip hop songs haha 4. Rock- This genre involves bands with instruments like electric guitars, keyboards, drums and synthesizers too at times. It's a very vast genre and has lots of sub genres like punk rock, alternative rock, hardcore rock, folk rock etc. Some common bands are Linkin Park, Coldplay, Skillet, Avenged Sevenfold, Breaking Benjamin etc 5. Metal - Metal is similar to rock although the emphasis is more on guitar. Metal songs are longer than average Rock songs with long solos. Metal is heavier than rock and just like rock it has lots of sub genres like nu metal, heavy metal, etc. Iron Maiden, Metallica, Slipknot, Behemonth, are some of the metal bands. 6. Indie- This genre includes artists that don't belong to a specific genre and consider themselves unique/different. Imagine Dragons, Lana Del Rey, Tame Impala, London Grammar etc The are many more genres, it's like a endless ocean of genres, you can know more about them online. Some other genres are Country, Gospel, Christian Rap, Bollywood, Kpop, Score/soundtrack etc
